item.title: Core Functionality of OpenCV4
item.description: Mat - The Basic Image Container Mat is basically a class with two data parts: the matrix header (containing information such as the size of the matrix, the method used for storing, at which address is the matrix stored …) and a pointer to the matrix data containing the pixe values. The matrix header size is constant, but the size of the matrix itself may vary. OpenCV uses a reference counting system.

item.title: Long-Short Time Memory
Recursive Bayesian Estimation
item.description: In the world of Bayesian Estimation, we model the world in such a way that all the changes in the environment take place at discrete, equidistant time steps \(t \in \mathbb{N}_0\), where sensor measurements arrive at every time step \(t \ge 1\). The discrete-time model can be seen as an approximation at the continuous case 1.

item.title: Robot Localisation
item.description: Filtering is a general way of estimating variables from noisy observations over time. Histogram Filter, Kalman Filter and Particle Filter are all variants of Bayesian Filter.

item.title: The Histogram Filter
item.description: The Histogram Filter is the most straightforward solution to represent continuous beliefs. We simply divide \(\text{dom}(x_t)\) into \(n\) disjoint bins \(b_0, \dots, b_{n-1}\) such that \(\cup_i b_{i} = \text{dom}(x_t)\). Then we define a new state \(x_t^\prime \in \{\dots, n − 1\}\) where \(x_t^\prime = i\) if and only if \(x_t \in b_i\). Since \(x_t^\prime\) has a discrete, finite state space, we can use the discrete Bayes Filter to calculate \(\text{bel}(x^\prime_t)\).

item.title: Elements of Programming Interviews in Python
item.description: Be very comfortable with bitwise operators, particularly XOR. Understand how to use masks and create them in an machine independent way Know how fast ways to clear the lowermost set bit (and by extension, set the lowermost 0, get its index, etc.) Understand signedness and its implications to shifting Consider using a cache to accelerate operations by using it to brute-force small inputs Be aware that commutativity and associativity can be used to perform operations in parallel and reorder operations.
